SENT.plain: Follicular lymphoma is the most common type of primary cutaneous B-cell lymphomas with a predilection for the scalp, forehead, and trunk
Herein we report a case of primary cutaneous follicle center lymphoma on the scalp of 72-year-old female
The diagnosis was made histopathologically, confirming the presence of centrocytes and centroblasts
Complete resolution was achieved following administration of subcutaneous interferon α-2a at a dose of 4.5 × 10⁶ IU three times weekly for 3 months
